public abstract class AbstractSmallStepProofRuleSet
extends AbstractProofRuleSet

Abstract base class for small step proof rule sets.

$Rev: 377 $

Benedikt Meurer

Method Detail

register

protected void register(int group,
                        String name,
                        boolean axiom)
Convenience wrapper for the AbstractProofRuleSet.register(AbstractProofRule) method, which registers a new small step rule with the given name.

Parameters:
group - the group id of the small step rule, see the description of the AbstractProofRule.getGroup() method for details.
name - the name of the new small step rule.
axiom - whether the new small step rule is an axiom.
See Also:
SmallStepProofRule.isAxiom()

unregister

protected void unregister(String name)
Convenience wrapper for the AbstractProofRuleSet.unregister(AbstractProofRule) method, which takes a rule name rather than an AbstractProofRule object. The rule must have been previously registered.

Parameters:
name - the name of the rule to unregister.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if no rule of the given name was registered previously.
NullPointerException - if name is null.
See Also:
#register(int, String, Method, Method), AbstractProofRuleSet.unregister(AbstractProofRule)

evaluate

public Expression evaluate(SmallStepProofContext context,
                           Expression expression)
Evaluates the next small steps for the expression and returns the resulting Expression. The resulting Store is available from the context and the ProofSteps are added to the context as well. This method determines the class of the expression (i.e. Application for applications) and then looks for a method named evaluateClass (i.e. evaluateApplication for applications). The method is passed the context and the expression. If no such method exists, a method for the parent class of the expression will be search and so on. If no method is found, the expression will be returned and context will not be modified.

Parameters:
context - the small step proof context.
expression - the expression for which to evaluate the next small step.
Returns:
the resulting expression.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if context or expression is null.
See Also:
lookupMethod(String, Class)

lookupMethod

protected Method lookupMethod(String baseName,
                              Class clazz)
                       throws NoSuchMethodException
Looks up the method with the given baseName and clazz. I.e. if baseName is "apply" and clazz is Application, the method applyApplication() will be looked up.

Parameters:
baseName - the basename of the method.
clazz - class whose name is used in the method name.
Returns:
the Method object.
Throws:
NoSuchMethodException - if the method cannot be found.
NullPointerException - if baseName or clazz is null.
